intro: Lasianthera apicalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. Lasianthera apicalis is valued not only for its aesthetic appeal but also for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
